result.execSummary:
The defendant Tonya R. Beining was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Injury by Negligent Use/Weapon/Explosive [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.24(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharge.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tonya R. Beining

Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney H Koesser.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 1 year w/conditions; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $250 DNA surcharge.
Filed by ADA M Graveley.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney H Koesser.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Case remains set for trial.  DDA Graveley puts the offer on the record.  Ludwig hearing set for 9/25/15 at 8:15am.  Bond continued.

No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
